vocabulary.name: Entity
vocabulary.notes: The `Entity` is the base of all of types.

vocabulary.name: Object
vocabulary.notes: Describes an object of any kind. The `Object` type serves as the base type for most of the other kinds of objects defined in the Activity Vocabulary, including other Core types such as `Activity`, `IntransitiveActivity`, `Collection` and `OrderedCollection`.

vocabulary.name: Link
vocabulary.notes: A `Link` is an indirect, qualified reference to a resource identified by a URL. The fundamental model for links is established by [ RFC5988]. Many of the properties defined by the Activity Vocabulary allow values that are either instances of `Object` or `Link`. When a `Link` is used, it establishes a qualified relation connecting the subject (the containing object) to the resource identified by the `href`. Properties of the `Link` are properties of the reference as opposed to properties of the resource.

vocabulary.name: Activity
vocabulary.notes: An `Activity` is a subtype of `Object` that describes some form of action that may happen, is currently happening, or has already happened. The `Activity` type itself serves as an abstract base type for all types of activities. It is important to note that the `Activity` type itself does not carry any specific semantics about the kind of action being taken.

vocabulary.name: IntransitiveActivity
vocabulary.notes: Instances of `IntransitiveActivity` are a subtype of `Activity` representing intransitive actions. The `object` property is therefore inappropriate for these activities.

vocabulary.name: Collection
vocabulary.notes: A `Collection` is a subtype of `Object` that represents ordered or unordered sets of `Object` or `Link` instances. Refer to the Activity Streams 2.0 Core specification for a complete description of the `Collection` type.

vocabulary.name: OrderedCollection
vocabulary.notes: A subtype of `Collection` in which members of the logical collection are assumed to always be strictly ordered.

vocabulary.name: CollectionPage
vocabulary.notes: Used to represent distinct subsets of items from a `Collection`. Refer to the Activity Streams 2.0 Core for a complete description of the `CollectionPage` object.

vocabulary.name: OrderedCollectionPage
vocabulary.notes: Used to represent ordered subsets of items from an `OrderedCollection`. Refer to the Activity Streams 2.0 Core for a complete description of the `OrderedCollectionPage` object.

vocabulary.name: Accept
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` accepts the `object`. The `target` property can be used in certain circumstances to indicate the context into which the `object` has been accepted.

vocabulary.name: Add
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` has added the `object` to the `target`. If the `target` property is not explicitly specified, the target would need to be determined implicitly by context. The `origin` can be used to identify the context from which the `object` originated.

vocabulary.name: Announce
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` is calling the `target`'s attention the `object`. The `origin` typically has no defined meaning.

vocabulary.name: Arrive
vocabulary.notes: An `IntransitiveActivity` that indicates that the `actor` has arrived at the `location`. The `origin` can be used to identify the context from which the `actor` originated. The `target` typically has no defined meaning.

vocabulary.name: Block
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` is blocking the `object`. Blocking is a stronger form of `Ignore`. The typical use is to support social systems that allow one user to block activities or content of other users. The `target` and `origin` typically have no defined meaning.

vocabulary.name: Create
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` has created the `object`.

vocabulary.name: Delete
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` has deleted the `object`. If specified, the `origin` indicates the context from which the `object` was deleted.

vocabulary.name: Dislike
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` dislikes the `object`.

vocabulary.name: Flag
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` is "flagging" the `object`. Flagging is defined in the sense common to many social platforms as reporting content as being inappropriate for any number of reasons.

vocabulary.name: Follow
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` is "following" the `object`. Following is defined in the sense typically used within Social systems in which the actor is interested in any activity performed by or on the object. The `target` and `origin` typically have no defined meaning.

vocabulary.name: Ignore
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` is ignoring the `object`. The `target` and `origin` typically have no defined meaning.

vocabulary.name: Invite
vocabulary.notes: A specialization of `Offer` in which the `actor` is extending an invitation for the `object` to the `target`.

vocabulary.name: Join
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` has joined the `object`. The `target` and `origin` typically have no defined meaning.

vocabulary.name: Leave
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` has left the `object`. The `target` and `origin` typically have no meaning.

vocabulary.name: Like
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` likes, recommends or endorses the `object`. The `target` and `origin` typically have no defined meaning.

vocabulary.name: Listen
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` has listened to the `object`.

vocabulary.name: Move
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` has moved `object` from `origin` to `target`. If the `origin` or `target` are not specified, either can be determined by context.

vocabulary.name: Offer
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` is offering the `object`. If specified, the `target` indicates the entity to which the `object` is being offered.

vocabulary.name: Question
vocabulary.notes: Represents a question being asked. Question objects are an extension of `IntransitiveActivity`. That is, the `Question` object is an `Activity`, but the direct object is the question itself and therefore it would not contain an `object` property. Either of the `anyOf` and `oneOf` properties MAY be used to express possible answers, but a Question object MUST NOT have both properties.

vocabulary.name: Reject
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` is rejecting the `object`. The `target` and `origin` typically have no defined meaning.

vocabulary.name: Read
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` has read the `object`.

vocabulary.name: Remove
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` is removing the `object`. If specified, the `origin` indicates the context from which the `object` is being removed.

vocabulary.name: TentativeReject
vocabulary.notes: A specialization of `Reject` in which the rejection is considered tentative.

vocabulary.name: TentativeAccept
vocabulary.notes: A specialization of `Accept` indicating that the acceptance is tentative.

vocabulary.name: Travel
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` is traveling to `target` from `origin`. `Travel` is an `IntransitiveObject` whose `actor` specifies the direct object. If the `target` or `origin` are not specified, either can be determined by context.

vocabulary.name: Undo
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` is undoing the `object`. In most cases, the `object` will be an `Activity` describing some previously performed action (for instance, a person may have previously "liked" an article but, for whatever reason, might choose to undo that like at some later point in time). The `target` and `origin` typically have no defined meaning.

vocabulary.name: Update
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` has updated the `object`. Note, however, that this vocabulary does not define a mechanism for describing the actual set of modifications made to `object`. The `target` and `origin` typically have no defined meaning.

vocabulary.name: View
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that the `actor` has viewed the `object`.

vocabulary.name: Application
vocabulary.notes: Describes a software application.

vocabulary.name: Group
vocabulary.notes: Represents a formal or informal collective of Actors.

vocabulary.name: Organization
vocabulary.notes: Represents an organization.

vocabulary.name: Person
vocabulary.notes: Represents an individual person.

vocabulary.name: Service
vocabulary.notes: Represents a service of any kind.

vocabulary.name: Article
vocabulary.notes: Represents any kind of multi-paragraph written work.

vocabulary.name: Audio
vocabulary.notes: Represents an audio document of any kind.

vocabulary.name: Document
vocabulary.notes: Represents a document of any kind.

vocabulary.name: Event
vocabulary.notes: Represents any kind of event.

vocabulary.name: Image
vocabulary.notes: Represents an image document of any kind.

vocabulary.name: Note
vocabulary.notes: Represents a short written work typically less than a single paragraph in length.

vocabulary.name: Page
vocabulary.notes: Represents a Web Page.

vocabulary.name: Place
vocabulary.notes: Represents a logical or physical location. See 5.3 Representing Places for additional information.

vocabulary.name: Profile
vocabulary.notes: A `Profile` is a content object that describes another `Object`, typically used to describe `Actor Type` objects. The `describes` property is used to reference the object being described by the profile.

vocabulary.name: Relationship
vocabulary.notes: Describes a relationship between two individuals. The `subject` and `object` properties are used to identify the connected individuals. See 5.2 Representing Relationships Between Entities for additional information.

vocabulary.name: Tombstone
vocabulary.notes: A `Tombstone` represents a content object that has been deleted. It can be used in `Collection`s to signify that there used to be an object at this position, but it has been deleted.

vocabulary.name: Video
vocabulary.notes: Represents a video document of any kind.

vocabulary.name: Mention
vocabulary.notes: A specialized `Link` that represents an @mention.

vocabulary.name: id
vocabulary.notes: Provides the globally unique identifier for an `Object` or `Link`.

vocabulary.name: type
vocabulary.notes: Identifies the `Object` or `Link` type. Multiple values may be specified.

vocabulary.name: actor
vocabulary.notes: Describes one or more entities that either performed or are expected to perform the activity. Any single activity can have multiple `actor`s. The `actor` MAY be specified using an indirect `Link`.

vocabulary.name: attachment
vocabulary.notes: Identifies a resource attached or related to an object that potentially requires special handling. The intent is to provide a model that is at least semantically similar to attachments in email.

vocabulary.name: attributedTo
vocabulary.notes: Identifies one or more entities to which this object is attributed. The attributed entities might not be Actors. For instance, an object might be attributed to the completion of another activity.

vocabulary.name: audience
vocabulary.notes: Identifies one or more entities that represent the total population of entities for which the object can considered to be relevant.

vocabulary.name: bcc
vocabulary.notes: Identifies one or more Objects that are part of the private secondary audience of this Object.

vocabulary.name: bto
vocabulary.notes: Identifies an Object that is part of the private primary audience of this Object.

vocabulary.name: cc
vocabulary.notes: Identifies an Object that is part of the public secondary audience of this Object.

vocabulary.name: context
vocabulary.notes: Identifies the context within which the object exists or an activity was performed. The notion of "context" used is intentionally vague. The intended function is to serve as a means of grouping objects and activities that share a common originating context or purpose. An example could be all activities relating to a common project or event.

vocabulary.name: current
vocabulary.notes: In a paged `Collection`, indicates the page that contains the most recently updated member items.

vocabulary.name: first
vocabulary.notes: In a paged `Collection`, indicates the furthest preceeding page of items in the collection.

vocabulary.name: generator
vocabulary.notes: Identifies the entity (e.g. an application) that generated the object.

vocabulary.name: icon
vocabulary.notes: Indicates an entity that describes an icon for this object. The image should have an aspect ratio of one (horizontal) to one (vertical) and should be suitable for presentation at a small size.

vocabulary.name: image
vocabulary.notes: Indicates an entity that describes an image for this object. Unlike the icon property, there are no aspect ratio or display size limitations assumed.

vocabulary.name: inReplyTo
vocabulary.notes: Indicates one or more entities for which this object is considered a response.

vocabulary.name: instrument
vocabulary.notes: Identifies one or more objects used (or to be used) in the completion of an `Activity`.

vocabulary.name: last
vocabulary.notes: In a paged `Collection`, indicates the furthest proceeding page of the collection.

vocabulary.name: location
vocabulary.notes: Indicates one or more physical or logical locations associated with the object.

vocabulary.name: items
vocabulary.notes: Identifies the items contained in a collection. The items might be ordered or unordered.

vocabulary.name: orderedItems
vocabulary.notes: Identifies the items contained in a collection. The items are unordered.

vocabulary.name: oneOf
vocabulary.notes: Identifies an exclusive option for a `Question`. Use of `oneOf` implies that the `Question` can have only a single answer. To indicate that a `Question` can have multiple answers, use `anyOf`.

vocabulary.name: anyOf
vocabulary.notes: Identifies an inclusive option for a `Question`. Use of `anyOf` implies that the `Question` can have multiple answers. To indicate that a `Question` can have only one answer, use `oneOf`.

vocabulary.name: closed
vocabulary.notes: Indicates that a question has been closed, and answers are no longer accepted.

vocabulary.name: origin
vocabulary.notes: Describes an indirect object of the activity from which the activity is directed. The precise meaning of the origin is the object of the English preposition "from". For instance, in the activity "John moved an item to List B from List A", the origin of the activity is "List A".

vocabulary.name: next
vocabulary.notes: In a paged `Collection`, indicates the next page of items.

vocabulary.name: object
vocabulary.notes: When used within an `Activity`, describes the direct object of the activity. For instance, in the activity "John added a movie to his wishlist", the object of the activity is the movie added. When used within a `Relationship` describes the entity to which the `subject` is related.

vocabulary.name: prev
vocabulary.notes: In a paged `Collection`, identifies the previous page of items.

vocabulary.name: preview
vocabulary.notes: Identifies an entity that provides a preview of this object.

vocabulary.name: result
vocabulary.notes: Describes the result of the activity. For instance, if a particular action results in the creation of a new resource, the result property can be used to describe that new resource.

vocabulary.name: replies
vocabulary.notes: Identifies a `Collection` containing objects considered to be responses to this object.

vocabulary.name: tag
vocabulary.notes: One or more "tags" that have been associated with an objects. A `tag` can be any kind of `Object`. The key difference between `attachment` and `tag` is that the former implies association by inclusion, while the latter implies associated by reference.

vocabulary.name: target
vocabulary.notes: Describes the indirect object, or target, of the activity. The precise meaning of the target is largely dependent on the type of action being described but will often be the object of the English preposition "to". For instance, in the activity "John added a movie to his wishlist", the target of the activity is John's wishlist. An activity can have more than one target.

vocabulary.name: to
vocabulary.notes: Identifies an entity considered to be part of the public primary audience of an `Object`.

vocabulary.name: url
vocabulary.notes: Identifies one or more links to representations of the object.

vocabulary.name: accuracy
vocabulary.notes: Indicates the accuracy of position coordinates on a `Place` objects. Expressed in properties of percentage. e.g. "94.0" means "94.0% accurate".

vocabulary.name: altitude
vocabulary.notes: Indicates the altitude of a place. The measurement units is indicated using the `units` property. If `units` is not specified, the default is assumed to be "m" indicating meters.

vocabulary.name: content
vocabulary.notes: The content or textual representation of the `Object` encoded as a JSON string. By default, the value of `content` is HTML. The `mediaType` property can be used in the object to indicate a different content type. The content MAY be expressed using multiple language-tagged values.

vocabulary.name: name
vocabulary.notes: A simple, human-readable, plain-text name for the object. HTML markup MUST NOT be included. The name MAY be expressed using multiple language-tagged values.

vocabulary.name: duration
vocabulary.notes: When the object describes a time-bound resource, such as an audio or video, a meeting, etc, the `duration` property indicates the object's approximate duration. The value MUST be expressed as an `xsd:duration` as defined by [ xmlschema11-2], section 3.3.6 (e.g. a period of 5 seconds is represented as "PT5S").

vocabulary.name: height
vocabulary.notes: On a `Link`, specifies a hint as to the rendering height in device-independent pixels of the linked resource.

vocabulary.name: href
vocabulary.notes: The target resource pointed to by a `Link`

vocabulary.name: hreflang
vocabulary.notes: Hints as to the language used by the target resource. Value MUST be a [BCP47] Language-Tag.

vocabulary.name: partOf
vocabulary.notes: Identifies the `Collection` to which a `CollectionPage` objects items belong.

vocabulary.name: latitude
vocabulary.notes: The latitude of a place

vocabulary.name: longitude
vocabulary.notes: The longitude of a place

vocabulary.name: mediaType
vocabulary.notes: When used on a `Link`, identifies the MIME media type of the referenced resource. When used on an `Object`, identifies the MIME media type of the value of the `content` property. If not specified, the `content` property is assumed to contain text/html content.

vocabulary.name: endTime
vocabulary.notes: The date and time describing the actual or expected ending time of the object. When used with an `Activity` object, for instance, the `endTime` property specifies the moment the activity concluded or is expected to conclude.

vocabulary.name: published
vocabulary.notes: The date and time at which the object was published

vocabulary.name: startTime
vocabulary.notes: The date and time describing the actual or expected starting time of the object. When used with an `Activity` object, for instance, the `startTime` property specifies the moment the activity began or is scheduled to begin.

vocabulary.name: radius
vocabulary.notes: The radius from the given `latitude` and `longitude` for a `Place`. The units is expressed by the `units` property. If `units` is not specified, the default is assumed to be "m" indicating "meters".

vocabulary.name: rel
vocabulary.notes: A link relation associated with a `Link`. The value MUST conform to both the [HTML5] and [RFC5988] "link relation" definitions. In the [HTML5], any string not containing the "space" U+0020, "tab" (U+0009), "LF" (U+000A), "FF" (U+000C), "CR" (U+000D) or "," (U+002C) characters can be used as a valid link relation.

vocabulary.name: startIndex
vocabulary.notes: A non-negative integer value identifying the relative position within the logical view of a strictly ordered collection.

vocabulary.name: summary
vocabulary.notes: A natural language summarization of the object encoded as HTML. Multiple language tagged summaries MAY be provided.

vocabulary.name: totalItems
vocabulary.notes: A non-negative integer specifying the total number of objects contained by the logical view of the collection. This number might not reflect the actual number of items serialized within the `Collection` object instance.

vocabulary.name: units
vocabulary.notes: Specifies the measurement units for the `radius` and `altitude` properties on a `Place` object. If not specified, the default is assumed to be "m" for "meters".

vocabulary.name: updated
vocabulary.notes: The date and time at which the object was updated

vocabulary.name: width
vocabulary.notes: On a `Link`, specifies a hint as to the rendering width in device-independent pixels of the linked resource.

vocabulary.name: subject
vocabulary.notes: On a `Relationship` object, the `subject` property identifies one of the connected individuals. For instance, for a `Relationship` object describing "John is related to Sally", `subject` would refer to John.

vocabulary.name: relationship
vocabulary.notes: On a `Relationship` object, the `relationship` property identifies the kind of relationship that exists between `subject` and `object`.

vocabulary.name: describes
vocabulary.notes: On a `Profile` object, the `describes` property identifies the object described by the `Profile`.

vocabulary.name: formerType
vocabulary.notes: On a `Tombstone` object, the `formerType` property identifies the type of the object that was deleted.

vocabulary.name: deleted
vocabulary.notes: On a `Tombstone` object, the `deleted` property is a timestamp for when the object was deleted.
